docs.text:
What if there was more worlds out there, past a special plane of existence that we humans alone cannot cross?

...

What if there was a hostile takeover in one of those worlds? How would that affect the people in that world?

docs.title: What is Realmspace?
docs.text:
Realmspace, an ongoing passion project by EliMCGamerGuy, is a character-driven story about the people after an uprising, told through logs, journals, recordings, and otherwise written or recorded word or action.

It is written by me alone, with the characters and lore living almost full lives in my mind. For more information, I would recommend reading the Realmspace AI Statement.

docs.title: Content warnings:
docs.text:
I've never actually thought about the requirement of content warnings, but Realmspace doesn't play coy with a number of topics. Here are some topics that its brushed with, including unreleased in-development acts.

  • Blood, essence, and possible described gore
  • Described or implied violence
  • Emotional distress
  • Depression
  • Suicide contemplation
  • PTSD or trauma
  • Loss or separation from family members
  • Mass emotional repercussions of a hostile takeover
  • Alcohol use
  • Mention of addiction
  • Brief inebriation/drunkenness
  • Intimidation
  • Genocide
  • Character death
  • Description of non-biological focus-based kni reproduction(alloying)
  • Partial nudity in requirement for medical aid
  • Possible sexual innuendo(might be in there somewhere...)
  • Caretaking while physically vulnerable
  • Descriptions of medical procedures, injuries
  • Censored swearing
  • Uncensored conlang(Knilang) swearing
  • Found family dynamic
  • Themes of hope, sacrifice, and patience
  • Possible Christian theming

This list exists to inform potential readers, not to give away story beats. The topics that Realmspace brushes with, I try to stay true to examples of and try to portray well.

Well, that's...a lot. I hope you still want to read it, potential reader!

docs.title: Realmspace AI Statement
docs.text: This document is for anyone reading Realmspace, and is interested in the part AI plays, if at all, in its creation.

docs.title: To begin:
docs.text: Realmspace is not made by AI. The story is my own, the characters are my own, and the documents are written with my own keyboards. I don't prefer works if I know they're made by AI. AI is not able, without immense computational power, to keep track of all lore, details, and character personalities and writing quirks that a human writer could after a brief reading of supplemental material. This, however, does not stop me from using AI for inspiration and iteration. This is why I felt the need to write this document.

docs.title: How is Realmspace your own?
docs.text:
I have been developing Realmspace since I first concepted Copper Steel as a character, then called Copernium, in mid 2024. Even back then it was in collaboration with AI, maybe more so then than now, since back then since it was literally me playing a character against an AI chat bot. Since then, I have taken Copper and Amethyst, and expanded so much on them that you could say that they aren't even the same characters as when I started. Back then, the majority of the characters didn't even exist yet. The current cast of characters were fully concepted, written for, and refined by me.

I've learned that, in each of my characters, there's a hint of myself. It's like I shattered and each character got a shard of Eli. Like, Cobalt has my closed-off-ness, Amy has my inquisitiveness, Copper is my personality thinly veiled, Shelia has my pop-culture references, and Zinc has my sarcasm and shares my joking attitude with Shelia. Of all my characters, I find Cobalt the easiest to slip into character. I've written a couple things as Amethyst (definitely has happened with the others too) that I had to take a step back and say "that's not Amy."

docs.title: How do you use AI "for inspiration"?
docs.text: Often, when I get done writing a segment, block, exchange I really like, or finish an act, I'll paste it into an AI and, with liberal use of retries, gather viewpoints I may have not seen, find errors that I didn't intend(typo, etc.), or ideas that could be used later down the line. I'm going to be honest, 90% of the AI's "continuation ideas" are garbage, but sometimes there's an idea or part of an idea that sparks "hey...I could totally see that in Realmspace!"/"with some refinement, I like that!" in me. None of these ideas, however, ever make an entire act. The acts are my ideas entirely. I'll also bounce my own ideas off of the AI from time to time. It's, in that case, more-or-less to keep track of them.

docs.title: How can you say that Realmspace isn't made by AI?
docs.text: I feel like I can say this because I've never copied something directly from the AI. Realmspace is a Ctrl+C/Ctrl+V free zone when it comes to AI. I've obviously used copy and paste multiple times with my own writings, that's how you have Amethyst's Experiment Logs, Cobalt's Field Journal, and Act 3 as separate files in the same folder, even though Act 3 IS Amethyst's Experiment Logs and Cobalt's Field Journal.

docs.title: Why not just consult actual people?
docs.text: That one's multifaceted. I'm not in any communities that would offer the feedback that I use, and to get the amount of feedback I like I'd need to be in a rather large community, but those tend to scare me off. I don't really want too badly to bug the few online friends I do have. I'll drop small parts of Realmspace here and there, and elaborate if they want, but I'm not going to drop a 500+ line doc in a discord chat and expect them to write a book report on it.

docs.title: What's an example of you using AI?
docs.text:
Most, if not all, would be vignettes. Like I said, the AI almost never makes it into the acts. Like, John's world building notes started as cleaned up and polished versions of my messages to the AI explaining the world of realm 04. He eventually gained this kind of "academic-adjacent" voice, and I find myself slipping into him whenever explaining the physics or metaphysics of Realmspace to the AI. Even in the vignettes, which aren't complete acts, but might be worked into the acts later on, aren't written by AI, but sometimes written in response to the AI.

The two times that I can recall using AI for the acts was help setting up the 2d6 dice tables for Cobalt's runs in Act 3, and getting an idea of what Amethyst would ask for the documentary in Act 3.5, but even then I generated like 20 for each character and walked away with maybe 4 to 6 per character. Then I completely rewrote the questions to maintain momentum, voice, and smoothness.

One time, since I defined Cobalt's mannerisms as "sometimes almost catlike" and it tried to give her ears and a tail for a good while. Like, "no, she's just a humanlike kni. Although she'd 100% play a beast race in RPGs."

docs.title: What are you trying to prove?
docs.text: I'm not really trying to prove anything to anyone else, I'm mainly just trying to convince myself that using AI like this is fine, and that it doesn't "taint" Realmspace. I've seen what people online do with people who do use AI, and I would like nothing more to steer clear of that mess.

docs.title: To end off:
docs.text: Realmspace exists in my brain. Not the AI. Every event, character, and setting are my own. I use AI to catch things that I otherwise would've missed, but it does not do the creation. That job is mine alone.

docs.title: Act 0 - The Legend of the First Man
docs.text:
Archival Copy, Kept by Amethyst Silver

Long ago, there was a great civilization in the first realm. It was started by the created beings from the created realm who learned how to pass through realmspace. Realmspace, at that time, was a dark, shapeless void with where the realms lie being mostly guesswork, and its existence and how to traverse it being a closely guarded secret. The created beings built a civilization in the first realm, energized by the raw, power-rich air there. They called this raw power "kna," or "unrefined energy." Generations passed and the method they used to pass through realmspace had been almost completely lost.

About seven generations in, the realm faced a famine like no other they had before. The soil bore no grain, nor did the kna in the air help at all. As it continued, the town's food supply dwindled, and people started to starve. One man, however, worked through the starvation, reading into the night by candlelight alone. One man who had no family of his own.

The man read of taking the kna and pulling it, gathering it and focusing it into an ability. Refining the kna into "kno," or "focused energy." The technique had almost completely been lost due to nobody deeming it necessary anymore. But the man read night and day, convinced that the kno abilities would be their solution.

After years of reading, experimenting, re-reading, and experimenting again, the man was able to open a rift to realmspace. The town, almost gone, started pouring all they had into helping the man, as he was their only hope. With their help, the man learned how to bind kno, navigate realmspace by feeling kna, and the three separate classes of kno.

After more months of experimentation, and with the two remaining peoples' help, the man learned that he could form kno into a line, bind it to the realm, and pull it through a rift. As the rift closes, you would think that it snapping shut would sever the line, but the kno of the line kept the rift open, microscopically. Just enough for the line and airborne kna to cross. The man would then run this line to another realm, through another rift, and bind the other side. This pulled the realms together and allowed fresh kna to spread through the realms from realmspace, albeit slowly. As the man weaved the realms together, realmspace itself began to take a more physical form. Very small sand and dust particles would pass through the rifts, and would settle in realmspace, pushed around by winds created by the flow of kna. Realmspace started to form a black desert.

After the man had finished weaving the realms together, he returned to his home town in the first realm. But there was nobody left. The crops just wouldn't grow, no matter what they tried. There were no animals in the realm to hunt, either. The man could no longer stay in the first realm, he had to find another home.

The man traveled through the realms he bound together, watching the weather, studying the plants, smelling the breeze, observing the animals, tasting the flowing water. He eventually settled on one singular realm. The realm he deemed to be the most worthy other than the created realm. He settled in the fourth realm, a realm with clean water, forests of trees, flourishing and familiar fauna, and usually calm skies. The man dug in, and built for himself a cabin on a hill.

Time did pass, and the man found that the ground took crops rather well. He had a much better first harvest than he ever did in the first realm. And when he wasn't tending to his crop, he enjoyed the scenery that the fourth realm provided. The rolling hills, wide, flowing fields, tall forests, and open ocean. And for a while, the man was satisfied.

But the man grew restless. He had knit together the realms to save his town, his people, but it was too late. He pulled the kno into his hands. He never truly had a family to call his own, and he had lost the very people he was trying to set free. Taking into his hands the ash of the fourth realm's trees to give kno form, he melded the kno into a being. He called the being "kni," meaning "Energy given shape." (AMY NOTE: I transliterated "kni," and it literally means "energy thing." Prefix "kn" = energy, suffix "i" = physical object. So, when we refer to ourselves in knilang, we're literally calling ourselves "energy things." That is stupendously on the nose.)

The being had pitch-black skin and hair, with warmly glowing eyes. The man taught the kni how to pull kna, form kno, and create illusions. He taught the kni the importance of recording and preservation. The man had made for himself a kni son, using kno and ash alone. And for a while again, he was satisfied.

Years passed, and the man noticed that his firauftkni could not work the farm fast enough alone, or with his help. It was rare if they had food left over before the next harvest because the crop would rot before it could be harvested and preserved. So the man took kno and more ash into his hands, and created another kni son. The man, having practiced countless hours with kno, could create much more finely, and created the kni to look more like his peers had. The second kni son had light skin, brown hair, and the same warmly glowing eyes. He taught his sirauftkni how to pull kna and form kno, and to take the power of life into his hands to help it grow, heal, or form vines. And once the sirauftkni was old enough to help the first, they no longer had worries of crop spoiling in the field. (AMY NOTE: "Firauftkni," "sirauftkni" and later "thirauftkni" are antiquated terms transliterated to "first descended kni," "second descended kni," and "third descended kni." Later translations of this text translate these to "first son," and so on.)

One day, a lone wolf laid hidden in the field, and attacked the firauftkni when the man wasn't looking. When the man heard his sons' shouts, he came running, with kno hardened into a sword. The man fended off the wolf, but the firauftkni's injuries were severe. With both him and his sirauftkni healing the firauftkni, he made a full recovery, but the man realized that he cannot defend his two sons from a hostile world alone. So again, he took kno and ash into his hands, and created another son. He created his thirauftkni with the ability to change his form, to blend in with any being he'd seen. To tell them apart, he gave this son bluish glowing eyes. He taught his thirauftkni how to pull kna and form kno, to fight and defend, and how to harden kno into a sword, a shield, or spears. The thirauftkni grew, and he took the lessons well. When he was old enough, he started accompanying the other two sons in the field as his father wished, fending off any dangers that may pose a threat.

Years passed, and the man became very ill. He would cough night and day, often with blood, and his temperature was higher than normal. The sirauftkni tried everything to help him, to lower his temperature and to heal his lungs, but it wouldn't help for long. The time came one night that the man gathered his sons.

Between coughs, the man taught his sons that through his and his peoples' research in using kno, he learned that everyone has a different form or signature to their kno. He taught them that the only pure kno signature was kno formed my humans hands, and that theirs were simple. He said that their signatures will become one of two types, dictate how they grow, and will be essential in creation of new kni, or to "alkni." Pure kno can alloy alone, and they would be able to alloy alone for some time, but at some point their kno signatures will be too impure and alloying will require two kni of different signature types. At the end of the lesson, the firauftkni and thirauftkni went to bed, but the sirauftkni stayed with the man, trying in vain to heal the man as he coughed blood again. The sirauftkni stayed by the man throughout the night. By daybreak, the man had passed away. (AMY NOTE: "Alkni": "Al"(to combine) + "kn"(energy) + "i"(physical, an object, a person, thing), "Alkni" = To combine physical energy things. What we would call alloying today.)

When the firauftkni had learned of the news, he devoted his life to being the fourth realm's first history keeper. When the thirauftkni learned of the news, he became furious. He was convinced that the sirauftkni hadn't tried hard enough, despite the sirauftkni's defense. When the firauftkni tried to calm the thirauftkni, he pulled his kno sword on him, saying that he didn't even help. The firauftkni, knowing that even if he did try, his illusions wouldn't help, stepped back and allowed the thirauftkni to leave.

The firauftkni, in honor of his father, collected his father's writing and research, and assembled it into books and organized it by topic for future generations to read and learn from, and eventually had a large family. The sirauftkni, in honor of his father, took life into his hands, created villages with woven vines, kept livestock, and eventually had a large family.

The thirauftkni was never again heard of by the fir or sir.

(AMY NOTE: It's a chilling read, knowing what we know now...Would the man have created his third son if he knew what he'd become? It's really a shame the names have been lost to time. I swear, I should know at least the first son's name. It's on the tip of my tongue.)

Mom sat me down today, and told me about being claimed. Our hope is starting to slip. There are still searching parties looking for him, but they still haven't found anything.

Mom says that when a kni gets too weak, or looses too much essence, their energy can be claimed by another kni. Usually, this happens naturally. An old kni will pass his or her energy on to his or her alloys. The claiming process leaves behind a white, ashy residue where the kni used to be. She said that, at this point, that's what the guard is looking for.

I hope not.

docs.title: Entry 35 (12/20/1533) (1BU)
docs.text:
Ferrite said Cobalt's birthday is on the 22nd. He's a cool guy, but sometimes a little cold. Quite protective of Cobalt. Not sure why, I didn't ask.

(Ferrite Wilton) Cool guy, but quite guarded. Ferrite's a humanlike kni with black hair. He looks rather strong, and it's a little intimidating. He's Cobalt's older brother.

docs.title: Entry 36 (12/27/1533) (1BU)
docs.text:
The winter solstice wasn't the same without dad.

I made sure not to let Cobalt and Ferrite down. Mainly Ferrite. He looks like he could probably fold me in half if he needed to...

docs.title: Entry 37 (1/3/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
It's the new year! It's now 1534AM. That's "After Man," not time. Time-wise, it's about 11pm.

There's traces of what looks like flour in the snow. That's odd.

docs.title: Entry 38 (1/10/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
I could've sworn I smelled something burning the other day.

Ok, that's not snow...

docs.title: Entry 39 (1/17/1534) (0BU)
docs.text: There have been reports of blackfires in the nearby woods. Well, that's one mystery solved. Another started, what is a blackfire?? The guard is doubling. We are to expect a replica kni attack. Dad is a military officer. His being missing doesn't fill us with confidence...

docs.title: Entry 40 (1/24/1534) (0BU)
docs.text: There's been rumors of replica kni in the city perimeter. Mom says they're just rumors, and that she hasn't seen any.

docs.title: Entry 41 (1/31/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Well, that's unmistakable. Zinc and I took a bit of a bicycle ride against out better judgement. The outskirts of the city are being burned with what looks like black fire.

OOOHHHH

There wasn't anyone around, maybe they already got an evacuation notice out to the people there.

docs.title: Entry 42 (2/7/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
The guard has released a warning confirming sightings of replica kni INSIDE the city...

That's...

That's not good.

docs.title: Entry 43 (2/14/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Zinc and I bike over to what the guard's been calling "the perimeter" now and then. They've sent out a memo telling everyone that can to stay within their homes. But the guard is getting tired. Zinc and I watching from as close as we dare...There's a lot of wounded people. A healer told us to go home.

If it keeps like this, would we be safe there?

The ash is..."whiter" today. It almost looks like snow, but it doesn't pack.

docs.title: Entry 44 (2/21/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
(There's a piece of paper taped into the journal.)

"CRYSTALLYNE GUARD PUBLIC MEMO

As you've probably heard from the rumors, the guard is wearing out. We've entered talks with the attacking replica kni. Their demands for peace are...disturbing. And what's worse is that they don't seem to be willing to compromise yet.

We will continue peace talks as time goes on. If you are able, please continue to stay in your houses. Your safety is our priority.

~ The Crystallyne Guard"

This was in the mail today. Mom is worried. I can see why.

docs.title: Entry 45 (2/28/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
(There's another piece of paper taped into the journal.)

"CRYSTALLYNE GUARD PUBLIC WARNING ANNOUNCEMENT

TO ALL HUMAN CITIZENS OF CRYSTALLYNE CITY:

AN EVACUATION HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR REGIONS WITHIN 20 MILES OF THE PERIMETER. PLEASE SEEK THE CLOSEST KNI-RUN SHELTER AND AWAIT FURTHER INSTRUCTION. SEE ENCLOSED REGION MAP TO SEE IF THIS EVACUATION APPLIES TO YOUR AREA.

~ The Crystallyne Guard"

They're too small. John, Jessie and I explored one last year. They're only built to house about three people, there's just not enough of them.

John and Jessie say they're going to stay still. We're not in the evacuation zone, so it should be fine.

docs.title: Entry 46 (3/7/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
(There's another piece of paper taped in.) "CRYSTALLYNE GUARD IMMEDIATE WARNING ANNOUNCEMENT

TO ALL CITIZENS WHO RECIEVE THIS:

PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT THERE HAVE BEEN CONFIRMED REPORTS OF REPLICA-TYPE KNI IN YOUR AREA.

THE REPLICA KNI HAVE PASSED THE PERIMETER.

THEIR INTENT IS TO HARM HUMANS AND POSSIBLY ENSLAVE KNI.

IT IS ADVISED TO STAY OUT OF SIGHT, AND USE ILLUSION FOCUS TO HIDE YOUR SIGNATURES.

STAY SAFE"

(There's nothing else on the page. Just a lone ink dot.)

docs.title: Entry 47 (3/8/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
My entries are daily now. There's too much happening to keep weekly entries anymore.

When the wolves passed our house, I felt relieved at first. But mom knew. She pointed out their eyes. That cold white that replica kni can never hide, even with form focus.

When she was sure they were gone, we, along with Cobalt, Ferrite, Amy, and a few others, left for one of the old watchtowers, just beyond the city's limit. It was dad's station when he was younger.

I found a few drawings in a dusty desk drawer with dad's name on it. If this is him... Man. I do look like a younger him. I've always seen dad with his touch-of-gray mustache, I've never seen him like this.

docs.title: Entry 48 (3/9/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
The city is billowing with smoke. You can't even see the buildings for the smoke.

In the commotion, I hadn't even seen Zinc, John or Jessie. Not to mention Shelia or Luke. I hope they're ok.

docs.title: Entry 49 (3/10/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
The city is still smothered in smoke, but it seems to be dy#ng d#wn n#w.

(The text is scratched away.)

The city is still covered in smoke, but it seems to be slowly clearing now.

Mom says we're going to see what's left tomorrow. We're spending another night in the tower.

docs.title: Entry 50 (3/11/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Crystallyne is hardly recognizable... The street is covered in ash and blood...What's really nagging at me right now is where John and Jessie are, especially with blood literally lining the street.

One of the kni that was with us in the tower, Saul, said that he's going to try to provide off-world passage to all humans he finds. He handed me his realmspace star map. Opening rifts isn't something I know how to do, but Saul said he'd teach me tomorrow. He said he saw something in me. Not sure what that means, but I hope I don't disappoint.

(Saul Friedman) A well-meaning guy. Saul is a humanlike kni, and professional realmspace navigator.

We found Zinc- or I guess he found us. He told us to get down out of sight as fast as possible. He's been watching the wolves, he said they take Stable St. pretty often.

I tried to ask about John and Jessie, but he didn't know either. Again, I hope they're ok.

Huh. Cobalt and Ferrite must've gone somewhere. They're not with us anymore.

Our house is a wreck. Mom mapped out where the floor once was, and confirmed that the suspiciously chair-shaped ash pile was dad's chair. She knelt down in front of it silently.

At least my room still has somewhat of a roof.

docs.title: Entry 51 (3/12/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Apparently, the wolf replica kni are prowling, seeking out and killing any humans they find with blackfire. That means that Saul, I, and a few other realmspace navigators have some competition. Saul said that blackfire is a type of flame only created by focus, that takes fuel and light to burn hotter than a normal flame. It's against Crystallyne law to teach it, and the replica kni use it as a weapon. Aye.

Saul taught me how to open a rift into realmspace today. Realmspace is a very vast, empty area. The ground is like this black sand. The stars in the sky, a little too perfect, unmoving, and every single one representing another realm. Saul taught me that walking in a star's direction will make the others start to fade. It's at that point that you can open a rift into that realm. Apparently, the stars only appear to kni. I'm not sure how that works, it might have to do with our eyes.

All the stars are in slightly random-looking constellations. Each one is different, however. That's how you can know which one is which. Realm 04 is in the Y constellation, and it's marked as one of the "habitable" realms.

What makes a realm inhabitable??

docs.title: Entry 52 (3/13/1534) (0BU)
docs.text: I got woken up at the crack of dawn by screaming. Pained screaming. Not John or Jessie, thankfully, but I still couldn't get back to sleep.

docs.title: Entry 53 (3/14/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
It's time for our first refugee run. Saul taught Amy only because she insisted. She's furious that the replica burned the school before graduation. She says she was on track to apply for a few advanced focus colleges. I never once thought about that. Hmm.

Saul rounded up about 10 people for off-realm relocation. Perfect since there's about 10 of us. He gave them each a choice for which realm to go to. He had this notebook by the end, describing the most viable realms. Realm 25 seemed the most viable by far, it's what most chose.

Amy took my notebook out of my satchel- rude- and wrote her name on it with a purple marker if we ever get separated. I guess the rudeness can be excused, haha.

I guided a man to realm 27.

Mom sliced some bread when I got home. It's a little burnt and she had some issue opening the metal breadbox, but it was ok, I guess. A little stale.

docs.title: Entry 54 (3/15/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Saul rounded up about 20 people this time. Seems like word of mouth spreads quickly, and people are desperate for a way out. I think a number of people ran into the woods nearby the city. I don't know what happened to them.

I'm keeping an eye out for Jessie and John. I still haven't seen them.

A man and a woman to Realm 31.

docs.title: Entry 55 (3/16/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
I got woken up forcibly this morning by a replica kni holding me up by my shirt collar. There was three of them, they took the form of humanlike kni. I remember word for word what the one holding me said, and I don't think I'll soon forget his eyes. His gruff voice. His slightly annoyed-sounding grunt.

"Mmh. Two monklikes. Write that down."

And he dropped me. Two. They must've counted mom too. One of them picked up my satchel(containing my notebook, journal, realmspace map, a few pens and some ink), and rifled through it. He pulled out the realmspace star map. I said it was for school. I hope it wasn't too fast a response, because the one who had held me up looked at me and raised an eyebrow. Then the one holding my satchel dropped it.

And they left.

I...never want that to happen again.

(Copper's script wavers slightly.)

docs.title: Entry 56 (3/16/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Saul rounded up more people. about 35 this time. I told him what happened. His eyes widened, but we continued anyway. I opened my rift last as I usually do and brought the people to their destination, realm 27. A woman and a girl. I didn't ask if they were related, it's not my business.

But now it seems I can't go back.

Realm 04's star isn't here.

I don't understand, does it have to do with the star map? The replica kni this morning? Realm 04's supposed to be in the center of the Y constellation, but it's just...not?

I'm trying to open a rift anyway, but I just can't! It doesn't open! Even bracing myself against the ground and twisting with my whole arm, it still doesn't budge!

Usually, it's just focus, chop, twist, and pull to size to open a rift, why is it so hard now??

docs.title: Entry 57 (3/17?/1534) (0BU)
docs.text: I've been walking in the direction of where realm 04's star should be for what feels like hours now, trying to open the rift every now and then. The other stars have long since dimmed. If I don't focus on the sky, it doesn't even look like they're there. Realmspace doesn't give much to tell time by, and I'm really lucky I know illusion focus to give myself some light to write by.

docs.title: Entry 58 (3/18??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text: I slept on the black sand in realmspace. How long? Eight hours? Four? Two? Half an hour? I honestly have no clue...I just know that the sand is getting into my robe, and it's really uncomfortable.

docs.title: Entry 59 (3/19??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Slept in realmspace again. The sand is starting to get into my satchel too, now. Regardless, the wind in this place makes me feel strangely energized now and then. I guess this is where we pull our energy from.

I've decided to check the habitable realms for any signs of anyone I recognize. Either that, or I just want out of this darn black sand.

Who am I kidding, it's probably both.

docs.title: Entry 60 (3/20??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text: Realm 01: The first realm. That energized feeling is really strong here! It's strangely peaceful, but that abundance of energy is staggering! There's nobody here, though. Well, not anymore according to the story of the Man.

docs.title: Entry 61 (3/21??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Sleeping here proved difficult with the charge in the air! But I got there in the end.

Realm 03: This realm has nothing in it. It's technically habitable, but it's just a void with a solid, smooth white floor.

docs.title: Entry 62 (3/22??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Sleeping here was like sleeping on a rock. I feel like I might've rathered the sand instead. At least that gave somewhat.

Realm 05: Still no luck with trying to find people I know. This realm has bipedal pig-people, though. That's a little strange.

docs.title: Entry 63 (3/23??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Slept under a tree. Probably the best I've had in the realms so far.

Realm 08: Forgot to raise my hood. Some people called me a "demon." Nobody I recognize. Found a few copper-colored coins on the ground. I slipped them into my satchel. Just need to remember that this is realm 08 money.

docs.title: Entry 64 (3/24??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Sleeping here was ok, I guess. Would've been better if the ground here wasn't as hard.

Realm 10: I'm not technically supposed to be here. Usually it's the humanlike kni that run imports from realm 10. The people here call it earth. I'm pretty convinced that there's no kni here, though. I did find a pair of old gloves and some sunglasses. I put them on and raised my hood, looking at my reflection. My robe is one of dad's old ones. I've never grown into it like he insisted I would, so the hood covers my head almost entirely. It's perfect, actually.

docs.title: Entry 65 (3/25??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Sleeping here was fine. Pretty middle-of-the-road.

Realm 11: This realm's ground naturally forms cubes. It's actually pretty interesting. But there doesn't seem to be anyone here. Oh well.

docs.title: Entry 66 (3/26??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Well, it's pretty interesting until you need to sleep on it. Those edges are sharp and not comfortable!

Realm 14: This realm has human civilization in it too. Nobody I know, though. Foraging here is pretty good, though. Found a number of blueberries and I think wild onions.

docs.title: Entry 67 (3/27??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Hah, forgot blueberries makes your focus turn blue for a while. That tripped me up for a moment!

Realm 15: Nothing. The only energy I can feel here is my own. Hmmh.

docs.title: Entry 68 (3/28??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
That was...probably the calmest night I've had so far. However, the search continues.

Realm 17: This realm has three moons! That's rather interesting, most realms only have one, like 04 and 10. Other than that interesting tidbit, though, there's not much here. No people. Found an apple tree, though. That was nice.

docs.title: Entry 69 (3/29??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
The ground underneath this tree is actually kind of soft.

Realm 19: When I got here and started exploring, I was spotted by some people, a solid couple heads shorter than me. They were curious what brought me to their region. I said I was looking for my people, not saying too much. They said that they haven't seen anyone pass through with a robe like mine in a long time, but they have a spare room underground if I need it. I accepted and thanked them. Being in an actual room makes a giant difference, even if I need to duck through a few hallways to get there and the bed is a stone slab with a pelt over it.

docs.title: Entry 70 (3/30??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
...I'm going to have to ask them what kind of pelt that is.

They said bear. I'm a little afraid of them now.

Anyway, back to the search.

Realm 21: Immensely foggy. I couldn't even see my outstretched arm! And it was an eerie silent. I didn't stay for long. Backtracked through the rift and had to let my journal dry before writing this.

docs.title: Entry 71 (4?/1??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
I have officially lost almost all concept of time. Thanks realmspace. Slept in the room in realm 19. Thanked the people again.

Realm 24: Not much here. Just an extreme hill with a few cows. At this rate, I don't think I'd bat an eye if someone here decided that these cows were their family.

docs.title: Entry 72 (4?/2??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Slept amongst the mountain cows.

Realm 25: I found a dilapidated cabin in the woods here. There's nobody around and no town nearby. There's a river with fish nearby, though. Took a closer look at the cabin. The door's slightly broken, the window's shattered, the interior looks like it hasn't been touched in years, there's a couple logs coming out of the wall on the outside, there's vines almost covering one side, and the bed inside feels like it's almost literally calling to me.

I decided that I'm going to stay here for a bit.

I took down the vines. I wish I knew how Cobalt made those vine ropes. Alas. I also put the logs that were falling out back into the wall, and tied them with the vines that I took down.

Going back inside, I found out there was a bookshelf. Almost all the books are water damaged, though.

docs.title: Entry 73 (4?/3??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Turns out that bed's so comfortable, I laid back on it and fell asleep. Well, comparatively speaking. The smell and stiffness leaves things to be desired, but it's better than stone. Could do with a bear pelt, though.

That was the first time I've slept and not thought about that day the replica kni woke me up. It was only, what, two, three weeks ago? But I remember it like it was yesterday.

I think I'm going to hang out here for a while. It's cozy here.

docs.title: Entry 74 (4?/4??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
I tried to read some of the old water damaged books, but most of them were all stuck together, or mostly stuck together, or rather moldy. I'll continue my search tomorrow, I just fashioned a net with the vines, and I'm going to test it in the river.

Well, it almost didn't, but the vine net worked! Caught a pretty good-sized fish. I think it's a bass? I'm not sure, I've never actually gone fishing before. Helped mom prepare them, though, so I know at least some of what I'm doing.

The cabin has a wood-fired stove. Do I trust it? No. Should I? Definitely not. Am I going to use it anyway? Probably.

Turned out fine, had fish for dinner...once I managed to actually start a fire. At least there was a ferrite rod in the drawer next to the stove. Oh! That's where his name comes from!

Can't lose sight of my goal, though. I have to continue searching tomorrow.

docs.title: Entry 75 (4?/5??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Woke up rather rested today. Took the opportunity to shake out my clothes and satchel. If only I had a broom for this old floor. I hooked the ferrite rod to my belt. You never know when you need fire, right?

Realm 27: No luck, no focus signatures nearby again. Found some of the people we helped, though. It was nice to catch up with them. They said that, in the month they've been here, they were able to integrate pretty well. No kni here, though.

The parks here are rather beautiful.

docs.title: Entry 76 (4?/6??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
I accidentally slept on a park bench. Man, that does not help one's back.

Realm 31: This realm was a wide open field, with only a couple people here. They weren't immediately scared when they saw me step through the rift. I like that.

docs.title: Entry 77 (4?/7??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Slept in the tall grass. It was rather pleasant.

Realm 32: No focus signatures here either. I would understand, too. This realm is just barely warm enough to be habitable.

Went back to the cabin to sleep, I'm not sleeping here.

docs.title: Entry 78 (4?/8??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Finally shook out the bed covering. It looks almost pristine underneath it...Still smells damp, though. Shame this blanket ruins how it looks. And smells. The blanket smells like a humid basement.

It's kind of cloudy out, I hope it doesn't rain. I have my doubts that this roof would hold water.

Realm 33: Struck out again. Just animals here. The sun here is purple, and the plants are this kind of blue. That's pretty interesting. It makes it look like I'm always focusing, haha. Not enough, though. No people here.

docs.title: Entry 79 (4?/9??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
I'm coming to the end of the realmspace sequence. Well, the habitable realms anyway. It's making me worried.

Realm 35: Can't feel if anyone's here. It's just sand for miles. A seemingly infinite desert.

I'm not sleeping in sand again.

docs.title: Entry 80 (4?/10??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
Slept in the bed again. I took the blanket down to the river to try and clean it but now it's soaked.

They say that going to realm 38's star sends you where you belong. It's only a tale, so I've never tried it. Never needed to. Guess it's worth a shot, right?

Ok, real funny, realmspace. It opened a rift to the cabin in realm 25. I guess even realm 38's star can't get to realm 04.

But that was the last of the habitable realms. What do I do now?

docs.title: Entry 81 (4?/11??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
After another day of trying to read damaged books without breaking them, I decided that I'm going to leave marks in the realms. I'm going to take a few rocks that I found and try to carve into stone in the realms, in Knilang, "Copper in cabin realm 25."

Knilang is like a broken Latin. Or maybe Latin is a broken Knilang? I don't know, but they're really similar. All I know is that we were required to learn it in school.

Maybe someone will be able to read them.

Amy, Zinc, Mom? Heck, Saul? I'd take anyone at this point.

docs.title: Entry 82 (4?/??/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
I have fully lost any and all form of keeping realm 04's time. I slept through the morning, through the afternoon, and I honestly don't know if I slept an entire day away or not. I just know that when I woke up, I was rather stiff.

I have to start conserving my journal pages, I only have a few left. It's only an 95-page journal.

docs.title: Entry 83 (Winter, I think/1534) (0BU)
docs.text:
I think today is the winter solstice in realm 25. It's hard to tell when you don't have the instruments required to accurately predict it.

This is going to be my first winter solstice away from family.

It almost makes the snow outside feel colder.

docs.title: Entry 84 (Spring, I think/1535) (1AU)
docs.text: I think it's the next year now. Has to be. It's spring here in realm 25. As I expected, the roof leaks like a sieve, so I've been trying to gather as much information as I can about roofing. Now it's half thatch, but at least it holds water. I can get rid of the buckets around now.

docs.title: Entry 85 (Winter, I think/1535) (1AU)
docs.text:
Another solstice away.

Mom makes these wonderful apple pies during this time of the year. She gets them in autumn, and then keeps them cold for roughly a month until she's ready to make the pie.

Man, I'm getting tired of fish.

docs.title: Entry 86 (Spring, I think/1536) (2AU)
docs.text:
And that's another year.

I'm finding wild onions and things. Maybe I should go to one of the other realms and get some packs of seeds.

docs.title: Entry 87 (Winter, I think/1536) (2AU)
docs.text:
My first winter solstice with fresh-ish vegetables. I literally have all the cucumbers I could ever want.

Dad used to light the fire pit in our back yard on the winter solstice. Then, he'd get out some imported graham crackers, marshmallows, and chocolate bars, and Zinc and I would have warm smores in the winter night, warmed by the fire.

I'm out here with a campfire, started with this ferrite rod and an old, dull knife from the cabin. My best approximation.

docs.title: Entry 88 (Spring, I think/1537) (3AU)
docs.text:
I traded my extra vegetables for more seeds a while back. Now my garden's even bigger.

At what point does it become a farm?

docs.title: Entry 89 (Winter, I think/1537) (3AU)
docs.text: As I sit in front of the campfire again, I get to wondering if anyone's actually seen my marks. Technically, it's cross-dimensional vandalism. But...it's for a good reason, I think.

docs.title: Entry 90 (Spring, I think/1538) (4AU)
docs.text:
I saw a fox the other day. I didn't even know there were foxes in this realm.

I had to re-thatch because the roof started leaking again.

You know, I really hope nobody ever comes over here. After working in the garden, I'm so covered in sweat, I'm basically idly giving off a faint purple glow. And that stuff does not like to wash out of monklike clothes. At least the glow fades slowly when in contact with water.

I swear, if a fish learns how to use focus...

docs.title: Entry 91 (Winter, I think/1538) (4AU)
docs.text: Man, I wish I had my top cloak. It's pretty much a small cloak, only going down about the length of a shirt, that goes over your standard robe. They're so much warmer than the robe alone. Almost uncomfortably so. And they're pretty much waterproof. I remember mom throwing a minor fit because I had spilled something on mine and she had to clean it, and cleaning it is rather hard due to it being nearly waterproof.

docs.title: Entry 92 (Spring, I think/1539) (5AU)
docs.text:
I'm looking into getting one of those straw hats from one of the vendors in realm 27 to keep the sun out of my eyes.

Oh gosh, am I a farmer now?

docs.title: Entry 93 (Summer, I think/1539??) (5AU??)
docs.text:
You ever get woken up by having a cassette tape thrown at your head by evidently nobody? Well, now I can truthfully say that nonsense sentence. I don't have a player, but that label in Zinc's handwriting..."For CU29"... For Copper. For me.

They're still out there. Somewhere. Now I know.

But where?

docs.title: Entry 94 (Summer, I think/1539??) (5AU??)
docs.text: Last week, I could've sworn while I was in realmspace, somebody was calling my name. It's probably just the loneliness. Or, maybe the mold in the bed is finally getting to me. Am I just submitting to the rot now?

docs.title: Entry 95 (Summer, I think/1539??) (5AU??)
docs.text:
No, there's someone out here. Somewhere. I heard it again. It's faint, I'm going to try to follow it.

Realm 04's star is back.

docs.title: (Tape 79)
docs.text:
(9/14/1539) (5AU) "Hey, Zinc here. Surveillance officer of The Underground. I swear, John, "The Underground" sounds much better than "The Resistance." Not so on the nose. Uh- Anyway, Log 79. It's Nevmont tevfor, 5AU. 5AU... It's been five years since we got our butts handed to us with a side of our friends, and the fifth anniversary of my position. It's 10:40pm, so it's time for my nightly check-in. To Amethyst, no signs of CU29 yet. Shelia and I have been scanning the market since you asked. We'll keep an eye out, though. Normal fluctuations of wolfpacks. They still like to stick to the main streets. We can probably get by through the side streets, instead of alleys only. Would have to check in with Josh. He's the Chief strategy officer, after all.

What's that, Shelia?

...I Have to go." (Click!)

This is my characters reacting to my 'conclusion' of their story that I'd written back in 2024. I wanted SO BADLY to return to Realmspace, to give their stories some closure, and it comes across. In reality, I just wanted an excuse to dunk on this old writing.

docs.title: Classes and Types of Focus
docs.text:
written by Amethyst Silver

Not counting advanced techniques, there are three classes of focus, centered around the three base types of kni.

The illusion class has minor illusion, major illusion, and physical illusion. Each illusion taking more energy and concentration to keep. Minor illusions are small, confined to a very small roughly 2ft range from the focus point, but are very simple and easy to maintain. Major illusions scale concentration and energy cost with size, and thus abide by no such arbitrary restriction. Physical illusion is the ability to make something appear, and even be able to interact with other objects. It takes a lot of concentration to maintain, but energy cost scales with size like major illusions. Monklike kni typically find this class to be the most natural class to specialize in.

The life class has grow, vine, and heal. The grow focus allows the focuser to accelerate the growth of a focused plant, granted the plant has the nutrients and water required to do so. Vine allows the focuser to grow vines in a focused area. Most of the time, pre-existing plants and soil is not a requirement. The heal focus is the most important of the life class, and is taught to all kni in schools. Heal focus allows the focuser to transfer energy between types, allowing a kni to heal his or herself, another kni, or a human's wounds. However, for humans, the wound must be washed before closing, or you risk infection. Given enough time and energy, a kni can completely heal even lost limbs or nearly mortal wounds. For humans, it is much more restrictive, limiting more to only being able to close wounds. Humanlike kni typically find this class to be the most natural class to specialize in.

The combat class consists of shield, sword, spear, and blackfire. The shield focus typically creates a translucent purple shield attached to the focuser's focused arm, but can take many shapes in practice. The shield's strength is directly connected to the focuser's available willpower. If the focuser runs out of energy, the shield shatters and fades away. The sword focus is similar to the shield focus, and is often used in tandem with it, but its shape is much more standardized. It appears most often as a translucent purple short sword, but some opt to focus it as a greatsword, holding it with both hands. Similarly to shield focus, it is susceptible to shattering and fading away if the focuser runs out of energy. Spear focus has two forms: pre-thrown at nearly the speed of sound, and stationary as a held weapon. However, few rely on spear focus as a main weapon. The spear focus, like the other two focuses, appears as a translucent purple spear about 4ft long and is susceptible to shattering and fading when out of energy. Blackfire is a restricted focus, not taught in schools. It appears as a dark flame that takes fuel and light energy to burn hotter and faster than typical fire. Its speed and heat makes it a very dangerous focus. Replica kni are almost always specialists in this class.

The form focus is a focus that only replica kni can use. Replica kni can see a living thing, internalize it, and alter their energy-matter makeup to take its form. However, this transformation is not complete. They can never mask their cool-white glowing irises, which ends up being a giveaway of a replica kni.

Among the focus classes are advanced focuses that don't fit into a singular class. Using advanced focuses feels like taking your energy into your own hands, and telling it exactly what to do. Of these, we know of rift, direct rift, feel energies, hide energy, and alloying. There have been advanced focuses in the past that the techniques for have since been lost to time, giving them legendary status, like focus binding.

docs.title: Addiction and Core Destabilization
docs.text:
written by John Hayes

Well, I should've expected this. Got asked if, since kni aren't biological, but alcohol still affects them, can they become addicted or if it's harmless.

Seriously, I'm not the only one you can ask. Amethyst or Radium could tell you just as well, they literally teach the teen kids.

But as long as we're here, I am the one who'll write you a short essay about it. There isn't really the same function there to make alcohol addictive for kni. They can get accustomed to the "soft" feeling it provides, sure, but there's no actual biological compulsion for them, so it isn't addictive. However, it isn't harmless. The Resistance bar cuts kni off nearly daily. I have to thank Jonas for his excellent work there, because without him we'd have a lot more core destabilizations.

Core destabilization occurs when the ratio of energy to physical matter becomes too out of sync. The kni's body will literally halt energy production from food and drink. This includes the unprocessed alcohol. This process is hard to restart, and almost never happens naturally, typically requiring medical assistance. Again, alcohol is NOT harmless to kni.

docs.title: Basics of Kni Physiology
docs.text:
written by John Hayes

Say Saul accidentally takes a finger off while trying to open a rift. We know rifts aren't forgiving. A thick, glowing, light purple liquid drops onto the floor from the wound. This liquid is called "essence." Focusing on the wound, he expends willpower regaining the lost digit. Willpower is latent, stored focus energy.

This is an ability all kni have, it's the heal focus, part of the life class. Their organs, known as "nodes," are made of semisolid focus energy-based matter, simply called "semisolid," doing the jobs that ours would. For example, taking food and making it into power, which directly fuels them as they are made mostly of energy. This is not required for the kni to live, as they do pull energy from realmspace as well, but eating also . Kni do have hearts of sorts, but it's only to circulate the essence in their bodies to keep willpower uniform. It's called their "core node," or just their "core." This is probably why focusing makes them physically exhausted.

And for the ash left behind when a kni's energy is claimed...That's what they are without focus energy. All they are is literally just a tiny amount of ash kept in solution with focus energy. Without energy, a kni is just white ash.

A note on claiming: Kni can already pull focus energy from realmspace. Doing so is slow but effortless. A kni can also pull energy from another kni that is too weak to resist, literally pulling their energy until the target is ash. Grisly stuff.

Makes me happy I attended the focus classes way back when.

docs.title: Kni Eyes and Glow Meaning
docs.text:
written by John Hayes

Kni eyes are similar in structure to our own. When not focusing, they have a defined sclera, iris, and pupil. But sometimes, when giving focus their all, their eyes will glow entirely. I've only seen it happen once or twice.

Kni irises almost always glow. They're just little halos of warm white in dark scenes. Glow color is dependent on kni type. Humanlike and monklike kni both glow a warm white, whereas replica kni glow a cool, bluish white. Amount of glow is proportional to the kni's willpower, or the amount of stored focus energy a kni has at their disposal at that one time.

Kni eyes are noticeably dull before being claimed. It's when they're at their weakest.

Jeez, just thinking how imposing and intimidating a replica kni would look in a dark room, with their cold, bluish-white eyes...At least it's the only part of them that their form focus can't change.

docs.title: Kni Facial Glow Mechanics
docs.text:
written by John Hayes

I got asked a question a while ago by one of the school-age humans of the Resistance. He asked, "If kni aren't biological, why does alcohol affect them?"

Kni are almost entirely energy, but alcohol still affects them because it's flammable and turns so easily into energy.

That's what I said in the moment. Let me expand on that here.

Kni are almost entirely energy, but alcohol still affects them because it's flammable, and turns to easily into energy. Being "drunk," for a kni, is essentially just an energy flood that makes things run a little loose. Kni, being part physical but mostly energetic, basically get overloaded with energy from alcohol, literally changing the ratio of energy to physical matter in their bodies. This alteration in the ratio of physical matter to energy influences the kni's actions and shifts them into a softened mental state, very closely emulating human drunkenness.

On a sidenote, "blushing," for kni, is perhaps a way for the kni's body to slowly use up the energy flood. It's not literally blushing, like how one's blood flushes their face. "blushing," or glowing, for kni has nothing to do with their essence. It's simply a coalescence of energy in a single spot, making the kni unconsciously focus, causing a purple glow and using energy. A similar, but far less extreme, flood of energy can be caused by extreme emotional states. For instance: embarrassment, excitement, surprise, or attraction.

Though, depending on the extremity of the energy imbalance, the negative repercussions of drunkenness are also emulated quite closely. Emotional imbalances aren't typically ever strong enough to cause this, but the kni's body will slow its burning of food into energy due to the sheer imbalance, unfortunately shifting the scale to the other side. This typically lasts for about a day, and leads to the kni's body having less energy than usual, leading to migraines and/or headaches. It's not quite understood why or how kni get headaches.

Needless to say, the First Man knew what he was doing with focus.

...

Some kni have...now, this is rather uncommon, but some kni have had success in alloying by inducing emotional energy floods through various means, harnessing the excess energy. However, Sapphire says the affect is negligible and works only as placebo. She is also worried that kni might start disrobing when completely unneeded. I concur. I know there's nothing actually there, but I don't need that visual in the first place.

We could launch into millions of theories to why female kni have breasts. And I could melt into my chair thinking about it for way too long. Let's do neither. I'll give you the top theories.

Theory 1: Female kni have breasts for readability. This is the most possible reason in my eyes. As we know, kni are not mammals, and do not produce milk. Perhaps otherwise, there would be little to tell focus signature by? From what I get from Shelia, kni can "feel" focus signatures, so maybe not for up-close. Perhaps it's for readability at a distance?

Theory 2: They store energy in them. There is no proof to this theory. Female kni's breasts have been found to only consist of semisolid.

Theory 3: Sex appeal. I hate how some people actually believe this. There's literally nothing there. This feels like a middle school joke. Kni literally don't have sex, why would they need appeal?

It's probably obvious which theory I favor.

docs.title: On Monklike Kni
docs.text:
written by John Hayes

Monklike kni's names are chosen from elements, crystals, and materials because they don't hold individualism as high as the we or humanlike kni do. Monklike kni often look more at the forest rather than the trees, typically concerning themselves about the bigger picture than small details of individuals. This does not mean that they don't care when one of their own go missing. They will see the effect of the missing party's absence, and will fight to bring them back, even if they don't know the missing party. Kni, especially monklike kni, don't leave their comrades behind if it's in their power to do so. This doesn't mean, however, that monklike kni don't form relationships to individuals. They do, much in the same way we or humanlike kni would. It just means that the overall is above self. This also does not mean that they completely ignore self, either. Amethyst has a line of purple dye in her hair, but she's also a very useful unit of the resistance, teaching the young teen class group. Actually, I've seen kni work even harder to save, rescue, or otherwise recover someone they know. One kni I knew literally laid down his life for someone he knew very well.

This group-over-self leaning, along with an innate yearn for archival and academics and their customary robes, is why they have come to be called 'monklike kni,' in English instead of the Knilang word for them, 'firauftkni,' which roughly means 'first descendant kni,' which implies hierarchy but hearkens back to The First Man. The first recorded use of the term 'monklike kni' was from a monklike kni.
